result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott E Bronson

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defn is eligible for SPD but no appointment has been made as of yet
Status conference on October 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

03:20 PM Defendant appeared.  Kyle Olsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of right to attorney.  Defendant given information regarding SPD and court appointed attorney.  Case rescheduled.  Status conference scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on June 27, 2022 at 02:40 pm.

Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence towards Nicole B. 
- Defendant shall not consume or possess alcohol. 
Trial Judge - Br 7 

Defendant has acknowledged and agreed to terms and conditions of bond. Defendant must return signed bond form within 10 days of today. Any bail money previously posted will not be returned until a signed bond form is on file with the Clerk of Courts.

08:49 AM Defendant appeared.  Will R Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Appearance by victim. All parties by Zoom. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts. Statement by victim.  Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 02:40 pm.
